newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Lira ERM talks difficult - EU monetary source.
newsitem.headline: Lira ERM talks difficult - EU monetary source.

text.p: Talks on the lira's re-entry to the EU's Exchange Rate Mechanism ran into difficulties on Saturday and a meeting of EU finance ministers could be needed to resolve the problems, an EU monetary source said.
"The positions are still far apart," the source said. "A meeting of the ECOFIN ministers cannot be excluded at this time."
"The more time passes the more the possibility of an ECOFIN nears," the source added.
The ministers would only be brought in if a political decision was needed to break a deadlock between EU finance ministry and central bank officials currently discussing the lira's return.
Rome hopes that by returning to the EU's currency grid it will qualify for the single European currency in 1999.

The ERM is designed to allow member currencies to trade within bands against each other -- for the most part fluctuating by no more than 15 percent from a central rate. Eleven of the EU's 15 countries are currently members, with only Italy, Sweden, Britain and Greece remaining outside.
